title: How to Fix No Sound on YouTube (All Platforms): 8 Easy Tips

steps.content: If you have an ad-blocker enabled when trying to watch YouTube, you may have sound or video issues. Turn off your ad-blocker , restart your browser, and then try watching the video again.

At the bottom-left of the video, you'll find the volume slider. Hover your cursor over the volume slider, and then drag the circle all the way to the right to increase the volume. [1] X Research source

Most browsers have the option to mute tabs. If you can't hear sound on YouTube, make sure you didn't mute tabs accidentally. To check, look for the volume icon with a slash through it located on the tab. If you see this symbol, right-click the tab and click Unmute Tab or similar.

steps.title: Make sure the volume mixer has your browser enabled.
steps.content: Make sure the volume mixer has your browser enabled. The volume mixer on your Windows computer allows you to set the volume of different programs. If you're using a Mac, you'll need to check your sound control menu. Windows : Find the volume icon in the bottom-right corner (you may need to click the up-arrow to open the system tray). Right-click the volume icon. Click Open Volume mixer . Click and drag the volume slider for your browser upwards. Mac : Click the volume icon in the top-right corner. Drag the slider to the right to increase the volume.
If your browser is experiencing issues, try restarting the entire browser rather than the YouTube tab itself.

steps.title: Check for any updates.
steps.content: Check for any updates. If you're running an older version of your browser, you may experience software bugs. You can find updates for your browser in its settings.
If sound isn't working on YouTube, you can try deleting your cache and cookies . This is a good way to remove corrupted data. Once cleared, restart your browser and try again.

steps.title: Check if YouTube works on a different browser.
steps.content: Check if YouTube works on a different browser. If you're using Chrome , try using Firefox or Edge instead. If YouTube works on the new browser, the issue is with your previous browser.
